characters.alibi: Claims to have been at home working on a grant proposal all evening. No witnesses.
characters.description: Dr. Aris Thorne is a renowned but eccentric astrophysicist, known for his groundbreaking theories and his chaotic personal life. He funded the expedition.
characters.name: Aris Thorne
characters.personality: Brilliant, scatterbrained, and prone to dramatic pronouncements. He is deeply invested in the observatory's research, seeing it as his life's work.

characters.alibi: She was supposedly calibrating the telescope equipment, but no one can vouch for her for more than a few minutes at a time.
characters.description: Dr. Lena Hanson is the observatory's lead technician, a meticulous and driven young woman with a reputation for being fiercely protective of her work. She was directly responsible for the victim's work.
characters.name: Lena Hanson
characters.personality: Precise, ambitious, and somewhat abrasive. She clashes with Dr. Thorne's more freewheeling approach to science.

characters.alibi: Said he was asleep in his quarters, but the on-site security guard saw him walking outside near the observatory around 1 AM.
characters.description: Ben Carter is the head of security at the Black Ridge Observatory. He is ex-military and takes his job very seriously. He has also worked security for Thorne in the past.
characters.name: Ben Carter
characters.personality: Stern, observant, and by-the-book, but seemingly loyal. He is dedicated to keeping the observatory safe and secure.

characters.alibi: She claims to have been stargazing alone at a nearby overlook all night. There is no one to confirm this.
characters.description: Maya Singh is a visiting astronomer from India, specializing in dark matter research. She is known as a quiet and very private person.
characters.name: Maya Singh
characters.personality: Reserved, analytical, and intensely focused on her research. She keeps to herself and avoids social interaction.

characters.alibi: He was at the local bar, 'The Dusty Lens,' until closing time. Several patrons can confirm this.
characters.description: Jake Riley is a local handyman who occasionally does odd jobs at the observatory. He is looked at warily by the scientists although he insists on being part of the community.
characters.name: Jake Riley
characters.personality: Friendly, easygoing, and somewhat nosy. He is always eager to lend a hand, but sometimes crosses the line.

characters.alibi: Spent the evening in his quarters, preparing a presentation. His roommate, Neil, corroborates part of the story, but Neil admits falling asleep early.
characters.description: Neil Peterson is a young, ambitious graduate student working under Dr. Maxwell. He idolizes Maxwell and hopes to follow in his footsteps.
characters.name: Neil Peterson
characters.personality: Enthusiastic, driven, and eager to please. He is somewhat naive and hero-worships Dr. Maxwell.

characters.description: Dr. David Maxwell was a respected and accomplished astronomer at the Black Ridge Observatory, known for his research on exoplanets and his charismatic personality. His funding was being cut in a few weeks.
characters.name: David Maxwell
characters.personality: Charismatic, driven, and respected. He was well-liked by his colleagues and known for his passion for astronomy.

characters.alibi: She was at the staff social event at the observatory. Many attending scientists can confirm this.
characters.description: The observatory director who had recently informed Dr. Maxwell his funding could not be extended. She is known for being harsh but fair.
characters.name: Elizabeth Ward
characters.personality: Tough, efficient, and dedicated to the observatory. She is respected but feared by many of the staff.

characters.alibi: Was working late in the data processing center, analyzing images from the telescope.
characters.description: A quiet, unassuming data processor. He's worked at the observatory for over 20 years and knows the facility inside and out.
characters.name: Gary Miller
characters.personality: Quiet, meticulous, and a creature of habit. He is a reliable employee who keeps to himself.

characters.alibi: Claims to have been at home sick in bed, but no clear evidence is present.
characters.description: A local reporter who has been sniffing around the observatory, hoping to break a big story. He is known for gossiping and embellishing
characters.name: Paul Jenkins
characters.personality: Nosy, persistent, and always looking for a story. He tends to exaggerate and sensationalize his reports.

clues.description: A wrench, missing from Lena Hanson's toolbox. It has traces of blood on the handle.
clues.name: Bloodied Wrench

clues.description: A set of specialized tools used for calibrating the observatory's telescope. One wrench is missing.
clues.name: Lena Hanson's Toolbox

clues.description: The observatory's maintenance log, indicating that Lena Hanson was working on the telescope's calibration system on the night of the murder.
clues.name: Observatory Log

clues.description: A partially erased entry in Maya Singh's notebook, which indicates she knows of Dr. Thorne's debt problems.
clues.name: Maya Singh's Notebook

clues.description: Maya Singh was seen arguing with Maxwell at 2 PM on the day of the murder. According to other staff, she was very upset about the lack of telescope time she was being allocated for her research.
clues.name: Witness Statement

clues.description: A recent receipt showing a large cash withdrawal from Aris Thorne's account.
clues.name: Thorne's Withdrawal Receipt

clues.description: Financial records indicating that the observatory is in severe debt, and Maxwell's research funding was about to be cut.
clues.name: Observatory Financial Records

clues.description: A log showing that Ben Carter made his rounds near the observatory at 1 AM, but there is a gap in his rounds that lasts for 20 minutes.
clues.name: Security Log

clues.description: Ben Carter's military record showing a dishonorable discharge for stealing and selling government property.
clues.name: Ben Carter's Military Record

clues.description: A receipt from 'The Dusty Lens' bar near the observatory, dated the night of the murder. It is signed by Jake Riley.
clues.name: The Dusty Lens Receipt

clues.description: Neil Peterson's notes indicate that Maxwell was making a major breakthrough in his research, a discovery that other astronomers would be envious of.
clues.name: Peterson's Research Notes

clues.description: Neil Peterson's laptop contains a draft of an email to a competing university, offering them Maxwell's research data in exchange for a research position.
clues.name: Peterson's Laptop

clues.description: Elizabeth Ward's emails indicate that she had been under pressure from the university to cut costs at the observatory.
clues.name: Ward's Emails

clues.description: Elizabeth Ward's personnel file shows a past reprimand for workplace bullying.
clues.name: Ward's Personnel File

clues.description: Gary Miller's data logs show unusual data manipulation on the night of the murder, specifically related to Maxwell's research data. Maxwell's results were adjusted to be slightly less significant.
clues.name: Miller's Data Logs

clues.description: Miller's personnel file shows he was passed over for promotion multiple times in favor of younger scientists. The recent cuts to Maxwell are being considered for his position.
clues.name: Miller's Personnel File

clues.description: A log from reception at the Black Ridge Observatory showing Maya Singh never requested to use the nearby overlook on the night of the murder.
clues.name: Reception logbook

clues.description: Maya Singh's travel records indicate she has significant gambling debts.
clues.name: Singh's Travel Records

clues.description: An invoice from Jake Riley to Aris Thorne for 'observatory maintenance'. The work was scheduled for the week before the murder. Was this for legitimate maintenance?
clues.name: Jake Riley's Invoice

clues.description: A small notebook containing scribbled observations and questions about the observatory staff. There's an emphasis regarding Maxwell's work and its relation to others
clues.name: Jenkins's Notebook

locations.description: The heart of the observatory, housing the high-powered telescope and its sensitive calibration equipment. The site of Dr. Maxwell's murder.
locations.name: Black Ridge Observatory

locations.description: The living quarters for the staff at the observatory. Ben Carters quarters are here.
locations.name: On-Site Security Quarters

locations.description: Where the observatory's data is processed and analyzed. Gary Miller spends most of his time here.
locations.name: Data Processing Center

locations.description: The office of Elizabeth Ward, the observatory's director. A place of power and important decisions.
locations.name: Director's Office

locations.description: A local bar near the observatory, a popular spot for the staff to unwind.
locations.name: The Dusty Lens Bar

locations.description: A scenic spot near the observatory, often used for stargazing. Offers a panoramic view of the night sky.
locations.name: Nearby Overlook

locations.description: Where Neil Peterson sleeps and works. A cluttered room filled with books and papers.
locations.name: Graduate Student Quarters

mystery.description: Dr. David Maxwell, a renowned astronomer at the Black Ridge Observatory, was found dead in the observatory control room. He was struck with a wrench. The observatory, isolated in the mountains, becomes the stage for a tense investigation as secrets and rivalries come to light.
mystery.title: Murder in Observatoy

solution.method: Gary Miller, driven by professional jealousy and fearing for his job, sabotaged Maxwell's data to make it less significant, which led him to murder Maxwell when Maxwell confronted him.
solution.motive: Professional jealousy and fear of losing his job. He was passed over for promotion multiple times in favor of younger scientists.
